Hew York, N.I.
Please note that the Radio Club of New York University already maintains Associate
membership in NAEB. THIS IS AH ADDITIONAL APPLICATION FOR MEMBERSHIP ON THE PART
OF THE RADIO DEPARTMENT.
Radio Department offers an elaborate array of radio courses and, some work in TV*
Full time staff of three.
Physical facilities include 3 studios, 1 announce booth and 1 control room with
adequate technical equipment.
Department apparently does no radio or TV work on any commercial outlet but does
maintain and operate a "wired wireless" station which by their statement is a
"student activity and not an official university station". Wired wireless station
staffed by students with rather typical programming for such an outlet.
ARIZONA STATE COLLEGE, Tempts Arizona (Teaching Department)
(Production Cento)
College accredited by North Gentral Association and the American Association of
Colleges for Teacher Education,
College uses facilities of four commercial outlets in Phoenix and 1 outlet in
Mesa, Arizona. Department maintains its own “wired wireless" station.
College has good production record; maintains its own studios (2) good dimension
and treatment. Adequate technical facilities. They are adding to their present
equipment.
One full time director of radio-TV; student chief engineer. Make use of seme
50 faculty members from some 15 departments in their production work. Fundamental
courses in radio but no degree.
Application made by Richard H. Bell, Director, Radio-TV Section.
